SEARCH
Package assn3

Class RecipeManager

java.lang.Object
assn3.RecipeManager
public class RecipeManager extends Object
This class manages the input of recipes from an external file and outputs a shopping list file based on information received from RecipeManagerTest. The class records the recipes read from the external text file and stores them for use by RecipeManagerTest.
Since:
JDK 21.0.4
Version:
1.0, 04/06/2025
Author:
Simon Tan

    • loadRecipes

      public void loadRecipes()
      This method parses the external recipelist file called recipelist.txt that is located in the same folder that the program is running from. A relative path of "recipelist.txt" is passed to the Paths.get() method. The Path object is then passed to a Scanner object that is used to parse the file. The Scanner's hasNextLine() is used to determine when the end of the file is reached. The Scanner then reads input from the file based on a pre-determined format (see assignment requirements). A temporary recipe object is used to hold all the data for one Recipe before storing it in the RecipeManager's ArrayList.

      This method catches several exceptions...

      • InvalidPathException - If an invalid pathname format is used. Ex. "////pathname"
      • IOException - If the Scanner is unable to open the source using the Path object
      • InputMismatchException - If the file does not follow the pre-formatted content rules
      • IllegalArgumentException - If the file does not follow the pre-formatted content rules
      • IllegalStateException - If the Scanner has been closed before reading all values in the file

    • createShoppingList

      public void createShoppingList(String shoppingList)
      This method creates a "shoppinglist.txt" file based on a String received in its parameter. The method uses a Formatter object to write the text into the file.

      This method catches several exceptions...

      • IllegalFormatException - If the String passed in the parameter contains illegal syntax
      • FormatterClosedException - If the Formatter object was closed before being able to write to shoppinglist.txt
      • SecurityException - If the Formatter does not have permission to write to the file
      • FileNotFoundException - If the filename is not a writable regular file or a file of that name cannot be created
      Parameters:
      shoppingList - a formatted String that contains the quantities of bread ordered and total ingredients needed.
